title: City council approves changes to housing development
title_page: City council approves changes to housing development
maintext:
NORFOLK - Some changes were made to a redevelopment plan Monday night by the Norfolk City Council.
City Finance Officer Randy Gates told council members the developer of the Legacy Bend Redevelopment Project, located south of Meadow Ridge in northeastern Norfolk is combining Phase Two and Three of the construction process.
Gates said this amendment is considered a substantial plan modification requiring the full hearing process required for a new redevelopment plan.
“The new Phase Two will consist of approximately 154 dwelling units comprised of 41 single family, 8 townhouses and 105 multi-family dwelling units. This compares with the combined total of the original Phases Two and Three of 131 dwelling units comprised of 63 single family, 12 townhouses and 56 multifamily dwelling units” Gates said.
He said total costs of developing Phase Two is approximately $20.7 million comprised of approximately $4.8 million of tax increment financing leveraging more than $15.9 million of private funds.
The council voted unanimously to approve the amendment to the Legacy Bend Project.
